titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Troutt and Weatherington Hale, Indictment
CWG6779

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Marshall Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
James Troutt & Weatherington Hale

The Grand Jury of Marshall County in the name and by the authority of the Kentucky accuse James Troutt & Weatherington Hale of the crime of Roberry Committed as follows (Viz) They said James Trout & Weatherington Hale on the 26th day of June 1865 in the county aforesaid feloinously took and carried away one hors of the valued of fifty One hundred and fifty dollars the property of William Manley from the possession and in the presence of the said William Manley and against his will by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person. Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

W. W. Tice
Commonwealth Atty
1st J. D.

Information by
William Manley
Ruben Manley

A Copy Attest
J. H. Riley clk
Bail is fixed at Five hundred dollars for each Deft

Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Robbery
James Troutt Weatherington Hall
Filed July 1. 1865 & bench warrant issued to Calloway July 13. 1865

Test J. H. Riley
C M C C
a true bill
J. B. Dupriest
Foreman
A Copy Attest
J. H. Riley clk
